result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:37 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Defendant Dominic R Pilgreen in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Dominic R Pilgreen. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Wolff states his client is requesting new counsel. 
Atty Wolff makes a statement as to the second report filed in this matter. 
Atty Wolff states his client objects to the report and requests a hearing. 
Court sets a competency hearing.  Court will allow doctors to appear by video conferencing. 
Court will set up hearing with the two doctors and counsel in this matter for a hearing date.

Case called at 10:45 AM
Attorney Andrew Nettesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Dominic R Pilgreen. 
Defendant Dominic R Pilgreen in court, in custody.  
Attorney Wolff requests a short adjournment for another Review Hearing.
Court grants.
Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 10:45 AM
Attorney Andrew Nettesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Dominic R Pilgreen.

Attorney Wolff requests a short adjournment for another Review Hearing.
Court grants.
Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:28 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Dominic R Pilgreen in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Brandon Carlson, for attorney Peter M Wolff, in court for Dominic R Pilgreen.  Court reviews the case on the record and notes at the last hearing it had advised counsel it may need to recuse itself from these matters due to sitting on the Appeals panel.  Court also notes there was a second competency evaluation with respect to 18CF1137, and a report filed, and Atty. Wolff has filed a motion to withdraw.  Court will recuse itself from all matters and will have the cases reassigned.  The Judge who is assigned to the cases will then address Atty. Wolff's Motion to Withdraw as well as the 2nd competency evaluation in 18CF1137.
Filed by Atty. Wolff.
Letter from Defendant at Waukesha County Jail re: No longer wants Atty. Wolff as his counsel.
Appointing Atty Peter Wolff
Filed by Atty. Wolff.
